item.title: faelinwolf add a quote by Georgia O'Keefe
item.description: "Whether you succeed or not is irrelevant, there is no such thing. Making your unknown known is the important thing." -- Georgia O'Keefe

item.title: faelinwolf add a quote by Michael J. Nelson
item.description: "As grand and glorious as love is, it is not without its perils. Anyone who has felt the cruel pangs of rejection knows that love is best approached cautiously, as one would approach an angry, cornered brush-tailed possum. Yes, before throwing yourself into a relationship, it's wise to buy a sturdy pair of leather gloves, and to be extra careful of love's front claws and rows of needle-sharp teeth." -- Michael J. Nelson

item.title: faelinwolf add a quote by Sanaya Roman
item.description: "What you love is a sign from your higher self of what you are to do." -- Sanaya Roman

item.title: faelinwolf add a quote by Harriet Beecher Stowe
item.description: "When you get into a tight place and everything goes against you until it seems that you cannot hold on for a minute longer, never give up then, for that is just the place and time when the tide will turn." -- Harriet Beecher Stowe

item.title: faelinwolf add a quote by Marianne Williamson
item.description: "And no one will listen to us until we listen to ourselves." -- Marianne Williamson

item.title: faelinwolf add a quote by Alice Walker
item.description: "No person is your friend who demands your silence, or denies your right to grow." -- Alice Walker

item.title: faelinwolf add a quote by Tennessee Williams
item.description: "Time is the longest distance between two places." -- Tennessee Williams

item.title: faelinwolf add a quote by Buddha
item.description: "If we fail to look after others when they need help, who will look after us?" -- Buddha

item.title: faelinwolf add a quote by Rabindranath Tagore
item.description: "Love's gift cannot be given, it waits to be accepted." -- Rabindranath Tagore

item.title: faelinwolf add a quote by William Wordsworth
item.description: "Wisdom is oft-times nearer when we stoop Than when we soar." -- William Wordsworth

item.title: faelinwolf add a quote by James St. James
item.description: "Tease hair, not homos!" -- James St. James

item.title: faelinwolf add a quote by David Levithan
item.description: "Love and I once had a great relationship, but I fear we've broken up. It cheated on me, wrecked my heart, and then went on to date other people. A lot of other people. And I can't stand to watch it, since love's going to cheat on them too." -- David Levithan

item.title: faelinwolf add a quote by Marilyn Nelson
item.description: "What is gentlest in love is love's violence. Losing yourself in love, you reach love's goal. Love makes you suffer, as love makes you whole. Love steals your everything and makes you rich. Love is both meaningless and poetry. Captured by love, by love you are set free." -- Marilyn Nelson

item.title: faelinwolf add a quote by Marilyn Nelson
item.description: "The filth hissed at us when we venture out-- always in twos or threes, never alone-- seems less a language spoken than one spat in savage plosives, primitive, obscene: a cavemob nya-nya, limited in frame of reference and novelty, the same suggestions of what we or they could do or should, ad infinitum." -- Marilyn Nelson

item.title: faelinwolf add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "She was pleased to have him come and never sorry to see him go." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: faelinwolf add a quote by Henry Ward Beecherr
item.description: "Where is human nature so weak as in the bookstore?" -- Henry Ward Beecherr

item.title: faelinwolf add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Never trust anyone who has not brought a book with them." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: faelinwolf add a quote by James Lecesne
item.description: "This is how it works. I love the people in my life, and I do for my friends whatever they need me to do for them, again and again, as many times as is necessary. For example, in your case you always forgot who you are and how much you're loved. So what I do for you as your friend is remind you who you are and tell you how much I love you. And this isn't any kind of burden for me, because I love who you are very much. Every time I remind you, I get to remember with you, which is my pleasure." -- James Lecesne

item.title: faelinwolf add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "All the books we own, both read and unread, are the fullest expression of self we have at our disposal. ... But with each passing year, and with each whimsical purchase, our libraries become more and more able to articulate who we are, whether we read the books or not." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: faelinwolf add a quote by Kevin Smith
item.description: "Controversial' as we all know, is often a euphemism for 'interesting and intelligent." -- Kevin Smith

item.title: faelinwolf add a quote by Cornelia Funke
item.description: "Isn't it odd how much fatter a book gets when you've read it several times?" Mo had said..."As if something were left between the pages every time you read it. Feelings, thoughts, sounds, smells...and then, when you look at the book again many years later, you find yourself there, too, a slightly younger self, slightly different, as if the book had preserved you like a pressed flower...both strange and familiar." -- Cornelia Funke

item.title: faelinwolf add a quote by Sabrina Ward Harrison
item.description: "Barefoot travel allows you to get the true feel of a place." -- Sabrina Ward Harrison

item.title: faelinwolf add a quote by Ibi Kaslik
item.description: "Heart lesson #4: the unrequited heart. You can't make anyone love you back." -- Ibi Kaslik

item.title: faelinwolf add a quote by Gabrielle Zevin
item.description: "It was a nice day, and I don't mean that it was sunny either. It was humid and not too cool, like winter was getting annoyed with itself and wanted it to be spring just as much as everyone else." -- Gabrielle Zevin

item.title: faelinwolf add a quote by Gabrielle Zevin
item.description: "Love stories are written in millimeters and milliseconds with a fast, dull pencil whose marks you can barely see, they are written in miles and eons with a chisel on the side of a mountiantop" -- Gabrielle Zevin

item.title: faelinwolf add a quote by Kevin Kling
item.description: "I learned that when people see a dachshund, they have to yell, "A wiener dog!" Like "A rainbow!" "A Shriner!" "A shooting star!" "A clown!" "A nudist colony!" -- Kevin Kling

item.title: faelinwolf add a quote by David Levithan
item.description: "It doesn't have to be on Valentine's Day. It doesn't have to be by the time you turn eighteen or thirty-three or fifty-nine. It doesn't have to conform to whatever is usual. It doesn't have to be kismet at once, or rhapsody by the third date. It just has to be. In time. In place. In spirit. It just has to be." -- David Levithan

item.title: faelinwolf add a quote by David Levithan
item.description: "To love--to fall--is not a question. To touch--to kiss--to speak--those are questions." -- David Levithan

item.title: faelinwolf add a quote by David Levithan
item.description: "Love weaves itself from hundreds of threads." -- David Levithan

item.title: faelinwolf add a quote by David Levithan
item.description: "We'd said we'd keep in touch. But touch is not something you can keep; as soon as it's gone, it's gone. We should have said we'd keep in words, because they are all we can string between us--words on a telephone line, words appearing on a screen." -- David Levithan
